statement.tex: \text{Find the direction rations of the normal to the} \\ \text{plane which passes through the points $(1, 0, 0)$ } \\ \text{and $(0, 1, 0)$ and makes angle $\frac{\pi}{4}$ with the plane} \\ \text{$x+y=3$. Also find the equation of the plane.}

step.context: \text{Let the equation of the plane in question be} \\ Ax+By+Cz+D=0. \text{ If this plans makes an}\\ \text{angle of $\frac{\pi}{4}$ with $x+y=3$ then the following}\\ \text{must be true.}
step.reason: \text{If the angle between }A_1x+B_1y+C_1z+D_1=0 \\ \text{and }A_2x+B_2y+C_2z+D_2=0\text{ is $\theta$ then,} \\ \cos\theta=\left\vert\dfrac{A_1A_2+B_1B_2+C_1_C2} {\sqrt{A_1^2+B_1^2+C_1^2}\sqrt{A_2^2+B_2^2+C_2^2}} \right\vert \\ \text{In this problem } A_1=A, B_1=B, C_1=C, \\ A_2=1, B_2=1, C_2=0 \text{ and } \theta=\pi/4 \\ \therefore \dfrac{1}{\sqrt{2}}= \left\vert\dfrac{A+B}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}\sqrt{2}}\right\vert \\ \implies 1=\left\vert\dfrac{A+B}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}}\right\vert
\text{Since $(1, 0, 0)$ lies on $Ax+By+Cz+D=0$} \\ A(1)+B(0)+C(0)+D=0 \implies A+D=0 \\ \text{Similarly since $(0, 1, 0)$ also lies on it,} \\ A(0)+B(1)+C(0)+D=0 \implies B+D=0 \\ \therefore A=B=-D

\begin{align} &\left\vert\dfrac{A+B}{\sqrt{A^2+B^2+C^2}}\right\vert=1 \\ \implies &(A+B)^2=A^2+B^2+C^2 \\ &\text{(substitute A=-D, B=-D)} \\ \implies &(-2D)^2=D^2+D^2+C^2 \\ \implies &\pm\sqrt{2}D=C \end{align} \\ \therefore \text{equation of the plane is} \\ \begin{align} -Dx-Dy\pm\sqrt{2}Dz+D &=0 \\ x+y\pm\sqrt{2}z-1&=0 \end{align}
